intro: Ruellia obscura, commonly known as the dark ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its dark green, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically purple or blue in color, arranged in spikes. Ruellia obscura is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and showy blooms. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight.
